result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:29 AM Defendant Dallas Judson Berthiaume in court.  Attorney Jacob Gondik  in court for Dallas Judson Berthiaume.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Joshua DeLong-sworn and testifies- Deputy with DCSD. Relates incident. Witness identifies defendant.
Att Gondik objects
State clarifies, witness identifies defendant
Att Gondik cross-examines. Going off report from Deputy Souza
State objects- relevance
Court overruled
State objects- relevance
Court sustained
State objects- relevance
Court sustained
State- redirect
State rests
Att Gondik- no witnesses
State moves for bindover
Court binds over for arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter to Commissioner Lovejoy from Attorney Gondik re: Attorney Status Hearing
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion and Demand for Discovery

Adjustment Number: 22A 194732,
Payable Number: 151971,
Receipt Number: 22R 012960,
Amount: $20.00
No use or possession of alcohol. No in person contact with Haley Lancour.

3:30 PM Defendant Dallas Judson Berthiaume appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Dallas Judson Berthiaume.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $500 cash bond, no in person contact with Haley Lancour. No use or possession of alcohol. Recites defendant's prior criminal convictions. Attorney Hoffman notes local ties and family in the area. Will be starting employment next week. Ineligible for public defendant representation. Can post up to $500 cash bond. 
Court orders $500 cash. No use or possession of alcohol. No in person contact with Haley Lancour.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
